item.title: Johann Huizinga 'Nature and Significance of Play as a Cultural Phenomenon
item.description: One Liner Offers a historical approach to play and offers insights into play’s significance to the development of cultures. Summary In approaching a history of play as a significant and defining aspect of human cultures, Huizinga starts by examining play as a naturally phenomenon that is more than just physiological or psychological. Play, he argues, is a significant and signifying activity that mediates understanding between people. Presents this as a play-concept–a tension, mirth, and more than fun–that can be examined in a variety of societal and cultural structures.
